solution_line_template: If Val currently has {initial_nickels} nickels and finds twice as many nickels as she has in her older brother's treasure box, she will have {multiplier_new_nickels}*{initial_nickels}={newly_found_nickels} more nickels.
The total number of nickels she'll have is {newly_found_nickels}+{initial_nickels}=<<{newly_found_nickels}+{initial_nickels}={total_nickels}>>{total_nickels}
Since nickel is worth ${nickel_value}, the value of the nickels Val is having is {total_nickels}*{nickel_value}=$<<{total_nickels}*{nickel_value}={value_of_nickels}>>{value_of_nickels}

Val had three times as many dimes as nickels before she found the {newly_found_nickels} new nickels, a total of {dime_nickel_ratio}*{initial_nickels}=<<{dime_nickel_ratio}*{initial_nickels}={initial_dimes}>>{initial_dimes} dimes
Since a dime has a value of ${dime_value}, the value of the dimes that Val has is {initial_dimes}*${dime_value}=$<<{initial_dimes}*{dime_value}={value_of_dimes}>>{value_of_dimes}
Together, the value of the dimes and nickels Val has is worth ${value_of_dimes}+${value_of_nickels}=$<<{value_of_dimes}+{value_of_nickels}={total_value}>>{total_value}
